decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to create a powerful aggro strategy by combining the abilities of the partner commanders Bruse Tarl, Boorish Herder and Reyhan, Last of the Abzan. The deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and using efficient removal spells to control the board while applying pressure. By utilizing cards like Birthing Pod, Survival of the Fittest, and Eldritch Evolution, the deck can tutor for the right creatures to fit the situation. The mana base is carefully curated to support the color requirements of the deck and ensure smooth gameplay. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a versatile and aggressive strategy while maintaining control of the battlefield.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and disruptive spells while using Geist of Saint Traft as the commander to pressure the opponent. The deck includes a wide variety of counterspells such as Force of Will, Mana Leak, and Negate, as well as removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Path to Exile. The deck also includes cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Spell Queller for additional control and card advantage. With a mix of versatile spells and powerful creatures, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily building a winning position with Geist of Saint Traft as the primary win condition.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless stream of aggressive creatures and direct damage spells, focusing on quick and efficient damage output. Utilizing a mix of low-cost creatures with haste and burn spells, the goal is to pressure the opponent early on and maintain that pressure throughout the game. The deck sacrifices card advantage and long-term strategies in favor of a direct and linear approach, aiming to win the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize. By maximizing damage potential and leveraging Zurgo Bellstriker's abilities, the deck aims to secure victory through swift and relentless aggression, punishing any opponent who fails to keep up with its fast-paced offensive strategy.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a wide range of powerful creatures and removal spells. The key strategy is to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent while using efficient removal spells to control the battlefield. The inclusion of Partner commanders Bruse Tarl and Reyhan allows for versatility in combat and synergies with +1/+1 counters. The deck also features a variety of tutor effects to search for key cards and a strong mana base to support its multi-color requirements. Overall, the main objective is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy that can quickly close out games before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize Yasova Dragonclaw's ability to steal opponent's creatures and use them to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. The deck includes a variety of low-cost counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to control the board and keep the pressure on the opponent. Additionally, there are multiple creatures that can generate value when they enter the battlefield or when they die, allowing for a synergistic playstyle that can overwhelm the opponent. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to all colors needed for the deck's spells and abilities, ensuring that Yasova can be utilized to her full potential in every game.

The main idea of this deck is to heavily control the game through counter spells, bounce effects, and extra turn spells, effectively slowing down your opponent and ensuring your own victory. Using Jace, Vryn's Prodigy as the commander allows for card advantage and graveyard interaction, while cards like True-Name Nemesis and Spellskite provide protection. The deck also includes powerful spells like Force of Will and Cryptic Command to further control the game. With a heavy focus on blue mana sources and spells, this deck aims to outsmart and outmaneuver opponents, ultimately leading to a dominant position on the board and a strategic win.

This deck revolves around using Radha, Heir to Keld as the commander to lead an aggressive strategy. The deck includes a mix of powerful creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent and control the board. The creatures in the deck provide strong aggression and value, with cards like Primeval Titan and Thundermaw Hellkite offering powerful effects when they enter the battlefield. The burn spells help to clear the way for attacks and finish off opponents, with cards like Lightning Bolt and Flame Javelin providing direct damage. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast creatures and efficient removal spells, ultimately securing victory through aggressive pressure.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game using a mixture of counterspells, removal, and disruption while utilizing Geist of Saint Traft as the commander to provide a fast clock and threat. The deck aims to protect Geist of Saint Traft with cards like Mother of Runes and Steel of the Godhead and control the opponent's board with cards like Balance and Cataclysm. The deck also includes various card draw and selection spells to ensure consistency in finding the necessary answers. Overall, the strategy revolves around disrupting the opponent's game plan, protecting Geist of Saint Traft, and utilizing control elements to maintain board presence and win the game.
